Description of incident: More than 15,000 students at Kapiolani            Community College are at risk of identity theft because of an Internet            security breach. School officials found that a computer was infected with malware that can steal sensitive data.  The computer contained the personal            information of 15,487 students who applied for financial aid between            January 2004 and April 15. The computer did not have sensitive information, but            it was hooked up to a network that had access to names, addresses, phone            numbers dates of birth and Social Security numbers.
